intro: Gratiola pumilo, commonly known as the pumice grass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain a single seed. Gratiola pumilo is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
